passage_text: Kittens, if the mother cat trusts you, can be held as soon as they are born. It depends if the mother cat trusts you enough to let you hold her babies. Holding the kittens, if the mother cat trusts you, is absolutely fine.

The kitten should be born within 30 minutes to 1 hour after strong contractions commence and subsequent kittens within 15 minutes to 30 minutes between kittens. There is often a rest period which can be one to several hours while the second horn of the uterus is engaged. the uterus has two horns.

Rating Newest Oldest. Best Answer: The average gestation from first mating to birth is 63 days. The earliest kittens can be born and survive is 58 days. The longest normal gestation time is considered to be 72 days but in my years of breeding show cats, I never had any go past 65 days gestation. 28 days after mating, a veterinarian may be able to palpate and feel kittens in the uterus.

Cancel. Cats are generally pregnant for 65 days before they will give birth to kittens. Signs of a pregnant cat will include swollen mammary tissue, swollen abdomen areas and the cat may start to produce milk.

A cat's pregnancy typically lasts 65 days, though it can take as few as 63 or as many as 71 days in some cases, according to WebMD. During her pregnancy, your little girl becomes more docile than usual, and she won't go into heat.
